page.description: Send email using the Gmail SMTP server.

prototypes.prototype: L email_send_gmail(C gmail_email_address, C gmail_email_password, C to, C from, C subject, C html_body, C text_body [, C cc [, C bcc [, C attachments ]]])

argument.name: gmail_email_password
argument.description: The password for the gmail account

argument.name: to
argument.description: The recipient's e-mail address. This can be a comma delimited list of addresses.

argument.name: from
argument.description: The sender's e-mail address. If the *[js:from]* parameter is blank (i.e. ""), the *[js:gmail_email_address]* will be used.

argument.name: html_body
argument.description: The message in HTML format. Leave blank to specify the message as plain text using the *[js:text_body]* argument.

argument.name: text_body
argument.description: The message in plaintext format. If the *[js:html_body]* property is blank, the *[js:text_body]* will be used instead.

argument.name: cc
argument.description: A comma delimited list of addresses to "CC".

argument.name: bcc
argument.description: A comma delimited list of address to "BCC".

argument.name: attachments
argument.description: A comma delimited list of attachments.

discussion.p: The *[xb:email_send_gmail()]* function sends an email using Gmail's SMTP server. For example:

page.example:
dim gmail_email_address as c = "jane.doe.productcore@gmail.com" dim gmail_email_password as c = "my gmail email password" dim from as c = "sales@productco.com" dim to as c = "mistymeadow@abcco.com" dim subject as c = "Demo follow-up" dim html_body as c =<<%html% Hello Ms. Meadow,

Thank you for taking the time to evaluate Product Co! Did you have any questions about yesterday's demo? I am here to answer any questions you may have. I look forward to hearing from you!

Sincerely,
Jane Doe
Product Co - We have your solutions! %html% dim text_body as c = "" dim cc as c = "" dim bcc as c = "" dim attachments as c = "C:\logos\productCoLogo.png" dim result as l result = email_send_gmail(gmail_email_address,gmail_email_password,to,from,subject,html_body,text_body,cc,bcc,attachments)
page.important: If your Gmail account is configured to use two-factor authentication, you will need to setup an app-specific password in order to use the *[xb:email_send_gmail()]* function. See *[extlink:Sign in using App Passwords@https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/185833?hl=en]* on Google's website for more information.
